alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 11:56PM CST until January 02 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, light snow continues with storm total accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 28 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 AM CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel is difficult on partially or totally snow and ice covered roads. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 for Iowa, or by visiting 511ia.org, modot.org, or idot.Illinois.gov.
